DOCNAME: CASE OF SARACOGLU AND OTHERS v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 5-3;Violation of Art. 5-4;Violation of Art. 5-5
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants were taken into custody by police officers from the Anti - Terrorism Branch of ORG . According to the arrest and search protocols , the applicants were arrested in the course of a police operation carried out against an illegal organisation , namely the DHKPC ( ORG ) as they were considered to be involved in the activities of this organisation at the university .

CARDINAL . On DATE the deputy director of the Anti - Terrorism Branch of ORG requested the public prosecutor at ORG to extend the applicants ' custody period for DATE . The public prosecutor at ORG granted the requested extension .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG requested ORG to extend the custody period for DATE . The single judge of ORG duly extended the custody period for DATE starting from DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants made statements before the police .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants were brought before a doctor , who noted that there were no signs of ill - treatment on their bodies .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicants made statements before the public prosecutor at ORG and subsequently , a single judge of the state security court , who ordered that PERSON , PERSON , and ORG be detained on remand and the other applicants be released . Before the judge , CARDINAL of the applicants , PERSON alleged that he had been subjected to ill - treatment while in custody .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants ' representative filed an objection with the court requesting that PERSON , PERSON and ORG be released . In his petition , the representative maintained , inter alia , that the applicants had been subjected to different types of ill - treatment while in custody . He alleged that the applicants had been beaten , deprived of food and water , that their testicles had been squeezed and electric shocks had been administered .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the public prosecutor at ORG filed a bill of indictment charging the applicants with membership of the DHKP - C under LAW and LAW no . ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the applicants ' release pending trial , holding that the relevant evidence had been collected and that the applicants were students and had to take their exams at the university .
CARDINAL . The applicants maintained before the trial court that they had signed their statements under duress while in police custody . PERSON reiterated his allegation of ill - treatment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG acquitted the applicants of the charges against them .
CARDINAL . On DATE the judgment of the first - instance court became final as neither the public prosecutor nor the applicants filed an appeal against it .

CARDINAL . On DATE CARDINAL of the applicants , namely ORG , ORG and PERSON , together with another person PERSON , who had also been in police custody with the applicants DATE , initiated proceedings before ORG and requested compensation for the time they had spent in police custody . On DATE the court awarded MONEY ( TRL ) –approximately CARDINAL euros- each to ORG , ORG , PERSON and FAC to GPE in respect of non - pecuniary compensation .

CARDINAL . The fourth paragraph of LAW ( as amended by PERSON no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of DATE ) provides that any person who has been arrested and/or in respect of whom a prosecutor has made an order for his or her continued detention may challenge that measure before the appropriate district judge and , if successful , be released .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of Law no . CARDINAL on ORG or ORG provides :
“ Compensation shall be paid by the ORG in respect of all damage sustained by persons :
( CARDINAL ) who have been arrested , or detained under conditions or in circumstances incompatible with the LAW or statute ;
( CARDINAL ) who have not been immediately informed of the reasons for their arrest or detention ;
( CARDINAL ) who have not been brought before a judicial officer after being arrested or detained within the time allowed by statute for that purpose ;
( CARDINAL ) who have been deprived of their liberty without a court order after the statutory time allowed for being brought before a judicial officer has expired ;
( CARDINAL ) whose close family have not been immediately informed of their arrest or detention ;
( CARDINAL ) who , after being arrested or detained in accordance with the law , are not subsequently committed for trial ... , or are acquitted or discharged after standing trial ; or
( CARDINAL ) who have been sentenced to a term of imprisonment shorter than the period spent in detention or ordered to pay a pecuniary penalty only ... ”
